name: Coastal Protection
description: This goal measures the amount of protection coral habitats and native vegetation provide by measuring the current area they cover relative to the area they covered in the recent past.

name: Conservation Economy
description: This goal measures the amount of money generated for the ecological protection and restoration of Tetiaroa

name: Sense of Place
description: This goal aims to capture the level of protection for aspects of Tetiaroa that contribute to a person's sense of cultural identity.

name: Iconic Species
description: This subgoal captures the species that are important to Tetiaroa  because they are relevant to local cultural identity.

name: Lasting Special Places
description: This subgoal captures the level of management of Tetiaroa's marine and coastal areas to best preserve aesthetic, spiritual, cultural, recreational, or existence value for people.

name: Biodiversity
description: This goal captures the conservation status of marine species.

name: Habitats
description: This subgoal measures the condition of habitats that are important for supporting a wide array of species diversity.

name: Species
description: This subgoal aims to estimate how successfully the richness and variety of marine life is being maintained.

name: Tourism & Recreation
description: This goal captures the value people have for experiencing and taking pleasure in Tetiaroa

name: Clean Waters
description: This goal captures the degree to which Tetiaroa's waters are polluted.

name: Resource Access Opportunity
description: This goal captures the access people have to coastal resources, whether or not they actually take fish or harvest from coastal waters.
